| HistoryText             = When [[Richard Rider (Earth-616)|Nova]] enlisted the help of the [[Guardians of the Galaxy (Earth-616)|Guardians of the Galaxy]] to confront the rogue [[Olympians]], half of the team turned him down out of concern for the safety of each other.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 6 1}} The mission was a success but it resulted in the apparent death of [[Peter Quill (Earth-616)|Star-Lord]].{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 6 2}} Stricken with grief, [[Gamora Zen Whoberi Ben Titan (Earth-7528)|Gamora]] and the Guardians that hadn't accepted the mission, [[Arthur Douglas (Clone) (Earth-616)|Drax]] and [[Groot (Earth-616)|Groot]], split off and formed their own team to return to their mercenary ways. They were joined by Drax's daughter [[Heather Douglas (Earth-616)|Moondragon]].

For their first mission, the team was hired by [[Black Bunny Brigade (Earth-616)|Black Bunny Solutions]] on behalf of [[Castor Gnawbarque III (Earth-616)|Castor Gnawbarque III]] to kill [[Rocket Raccoon (Earth-616)|Rocket Raccoon]] and stop the sabotaging of an energy-converting machine named the [[D-Type Converter]] at the hands of the other Guardians.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 6 3}} Both teams clashed,{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 6 4}} and Gamora's team failed their missions. During the confrontation, Moondragon merged with her [[Earth-18897|Reality-18897]] [[Heather Douglas (Earth-18897)|counterpart]] and joined the other Guardians. Groot had helped prevent Rocket's assassination, and also defected to the other team.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 6 5}} The two members of Black Bunny Solutions, [[Blackjack O'Hare (Earth-616)|Blackjack O'Hare]] and [[Otherone (Earth-616)|Prince of Power]], remained with the team. In the aftermath of the conflict, the two teams extended a truce.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 6 6}}

When the Guardians were reunited with Star-Lord, who heralded the return of the Olympians, Nova sought the help of Gamora's team, and the two Guardians teams stood their ground together agains the vengeful gods.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 6 11}} In the aftermath of the Olympians' defeat, Gamora's unit was folded back into the main team.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 6 12}}

| Notes                   = * This team is only referred to as the West Spiral Arm Guardians in the solicit for {{cl|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 6 3}}. This name is a reference to the [[Avengers West Coast|West Coast Avengers]].
